intro: Leucostegane latistipulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved leucostegane, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth upper surface and hairy underside. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that split open to release tiny seeds. This species is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
